name: Jquery-sortscroll
body:
## Demo Click on the "down" button to change this paragraph's order in the page. This jquery plugin is specially useful when you want to sort blocks on a page taller than the screen. The element being sorted will stay still while the rest of the page will scroll behind it. ## simple usage example ```html
content1
content2
content3
``` ##programatic use ```javascript //init plugin (default options below) $(".my-container-class").sortScroll( { buttonClass: "sort-scroll-button",//css class for sorting buttons sortableClass: "sort-scroll-element",//css class for sortable elements movingClass: "sort-scroll-moving",//css class applied to the element being sorted animationDuration: 1000,// duration of the animation in ms easing: "swing"// easing type for the animation }); //you can do something when sorting is done $('.my-container-class').on('sortScroll.sortEnd', function(event, element, initialOrder, destinationOrder) { var title = element.find('h2').text(); console.log("element named "+title+" was moved from slot n°"+initialOrder+" to slot n°"+ destinationOrder); } //you don't really need buttons $('.my-container-class').sortScroll('moveElement',3,-2)//move the element in slot 3 (zero based) 2 slots up (in slot 1) ```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
